file_content.text: Such strength... we were strong once. The weak perish on Taris. I--no! No, please!
The darkness comes to swallow me whole!
Stay calm. Let me take on your pain.
I can save you. [Shield.]
Close your eyes. When you open them, this nightmare will be over.
Trust me, master. [Shield.]
Ahhh!
The darkness... is gone! I am myself again.
But... Aris? No, please! Not her, not my Padawan! She has--so much potential, so much left to give....
Aris is one with the Force, Master Tykan. Her potential will be realized through all of us.
She'll never leave you.
"There is no death..." But I will never see my Aris smile again.
Aris was compassionate and brave. The loss of such a Padawan is a blow to us all.
She was a true Jedi.
And it's my doing. I should have been stronger, for her.
A Padawan must put the order's ideals before her feelings. What kind of Jedi would she have made?
Aris was a failure.
I don't know. I was... looking forward to finding out.
I sense your suffering because of me. And Aris... I'm not worthy of such sacrifice.
You spoke of a "Lord Vivicar," Master Tykan. Someone who was ordering you to do these things.
What about Vivicar?
Vivicar? The name is familiar, but... my mind has been ravaged by this illness.
The plague has claimed enough lives already, Master. Don't throw yours away too.
Please don't talk like that.
You're right, young Jedi. Still, it is my weakness that caused all this.
I risked my life shielding you from the plague, and that's all you can say?
Show some gratitude.
I apologize, young Jedi. I am grateful for everything you've done.
You've saved me. At great cost to yourself, I can feel it. I am truly sorry.
While you were ill, you mentioned a "Lord Vivicar." Do you remember?
Tell me about Vivicar.
No. I recall the name, but not what it means. I'm sorry.
The shielding technique is a strain, but it was the only way to save you.
Don't worry about me.
I owe you a debt I can never repay.
You must answer for your crimes. The people you killed deserve nothing less.
"Sorry" isn't enough.
Yes. You are right, of course.
I will go before the Republic and admit my guilt. Purge myself of this shame.
But it won't bring back my Padawan who followed me so loyally. Even into madness.
Finish your restoration work on Taris, Master Tykan. For her.
Honor her memory.
A noble idea. But I have other business, first.
It's a tragedy.
Thank you. I have a responsibility to make this right.
Aris could have stopped you; she didn't even try.
She made her choice.
I will not forget her. But I have work to attend to.
I harmed so many, and almost destroyed my Padawan. I'm not fit to be a Jedi Master.
We gain strength through adversity. Enduring the plague will make you stronger.
That's not true.
And you can pass on that strength to others, Master.
Don't make such decisions in haste; take time to reflect.
Give yourself time.
She's right. And I will always believe in you.
He speaks the truth. And I can give you all the help you need.
The Council may want to reconsider your standing in the order after this.
Maybe you're right.
But you will always be my Master. I promise.
I must report to Master Syo Bakarn and the Council. There's much to be done. I'm sure Captain Nelex will want to know you are safe.
Thank you, again. I... still can't believe the sacrifice you made for me. I only hope your burden does not become too great.
Thank you for sparing Master Tykan. I doubt Captain Nelex would have been so forgiving.
The Republic won't understand. When Master Tykan turns himself in... they'll never forgive him for this.
The Republic knows the value of mercy.
Yes, they will.
I hope so. He needs compassion right now.
Master Tykan has to accept the consequences of his actions.
There must be justice.
Yes, he taught me that, and now he must live up to it.
I wish I could be as detached as you.
Whatever happens, you gave him the chance to atone and continue his work. Maybe one day, Taris will be beautiful again. Thank you.
Don't worry. Your pain's about to stop forever.
It'll soon be over. [Kill him]
Give me the peace and the silence. Quickly.
I've failed him. Master Tykan needed me... and I turned my back on him.
He's my Master. How can he be dead?
Tykan was too far gone. And your attachment to him was unhealthy.
Both of you were in danger.
Unhealthy? The only thing I ever wanted was to be with him!
Personal desire distracts us from our true duty to both the Republic and the Force.
That's not a Jedi attitude.
It was getting so hard to stay detached in training. Perhaps you're right.
A Padawan's relationship with her Master is one of respect, not passion.
Listen to yourself.
Master Tykan was always so kind to me. I read too much into that.
I should return to Tython, and continue my studies.
I will honor my Master--and you, for showing me the right path. Thank you.
If you can't see what's unhealthy about that, then you're beyond my help.
Stupid girl.
The only person I want help from is dead.
Master Tykan had become a danger to everyone around him.
He made it necessary.
This is all my fault. I could have saved him.
Tykan has been freed from darkness, don't mourn for him.
Not dead, saved.
It's selfish, but I'd do anything to have him back.
I'll go back to Tython. Without Master Tykan, Taris will never recover. I can't watch his work destroyed.
I know you did what you had to. But right now, this is the last place I want to be.
Too late, Jedi. You wandered too long, too long. But now the reactor will bathe Taris in fire. No black rock. No shadow.
The Republic will not spread it! I can cleanse it here, cauterize the flow!
Think, Master Tykan. You're killing the planet you've been trying to save.
Not cleansed, destroyed!
No, fool! No! Weren't you listening? Lord Vivicar promised to guide me.
Destroy that reactor, and everyone you've tried to help on Taris will die. Including your Padawan.
Your friends will die, too.
My Padawan... my--Lord Vivicar commanded it!
This has gone far enough.
He spoke to the heart of me! Lord Vivicar understands!
Who is this "Lord Vivicar"? Why are you taking orders from him?
Vivicar?
He is--he commands me. I--I can't--
Is... Lord Vivicar in the room with us now, Master Tykan?
Keep talking, please.
He is here. And everywhere. He is--he--
It's alright, Master. I'm here to help you, remember?
I don't care about your delusions. Get away from the reactor or I'll kill you.
Step down or else.
Kill me? Two forces intertwined, Jedi, are too strong for you.
Master Tykan explained everything. I see the beauty in Taris that the Republic destroyed.
His work must continue to save Taris. And we will be together.
Aris, would a sane Master ask you to hurt innocent people?
You know this is wrong.
I--I know this isn't pleasant, but it's necessary.
Believe me, Aris, I understand how this hurts. But your loyalty is blinding you.
My Master suffered too.
You couldn't understand. Master Tykan has--has shown me the truth.
Look at him. Your Master needs help. The Force has given me the ability to heal him.
I can save Tykan.
But he--Master, perhaps she's right. Perhaps we should reconsider.
I don't--what if we just listen to him for a minute, Master, think this over again?
What's this? Such brightness in her, and she dares strike against me?
Never. I will not fight you, Master Tykan, but... you're ill. Let us help you.
It's not too late. Step away from the reactor, and I'll take care of the rest.
Surrender.
This doesn't have to come to violence. Don't force me.
No one needs to get hurt.
No more talk. [Attack]
They all turn against me! You brought this darkness here! The purification of Taris will begin with you!
You would devastate an entire planet, just on Tykan's say-so?
Then explain all this to me.
I--I only want the Republic to--no. No. Master, we should find another way.
The dark side has claimed you and your Master. I'm ending this now.
You've both fallen.
No! I won't let Master Tykan's work go unfinished!
If you want to be together forever, fine. But you're not taking Taris with you.
Then you'll die with him!
You were right, Master. The Jedi are quick to abandon their own. I am with you.
A brightness to stand with me. Yes. My Padawan and I.
Now. No more interference from this voice in shadow! Lord Vivicar's will gives me strength!
That's his problem, not mine.
